title.narrative: KNOWLEDGE AND EVIDENCE

description.narrative: Improved evidence based policies to address the causes of exclusion of boys and girls, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Education â€“ General, Evaluation, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health â€“ General, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Nutrition â€“ General, Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid), Research, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the most excluded boys and girls benefit from enhanced and inclusive public policies and services and actively participate in decision making processes.*Children most expected to benefit: Afro-descendant, Quilombolas, indigenous people, children with disabilities, with HIV/AIDS, in rural areas and in vulnerable urban territories, LGBT youth.

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Evaluation innovation learning, uptake and partnerships for evaluation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved evidence based policies to address the causes of exclusion of boys and girls

description.narrative: As part of the strategy to strengthen social protection systems to be more responsive to shocks, in 2021 UNICEF designed and implemented an HCT programme that benefited 4,500 vulnerable families. A third wave of the survey on the impacts of COVID-19 on children and adolescents was also implemented, showing that malnutrition and food insecurity increased in addition to the socioeconomic impacts. Therefore, the HCT focused on reducing child hunger. The methodology designed to identify child-related national public expenditure was published and was applied to advocate for a higher child-related budget in 2022 in the Congress. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/12/2021
